title: John Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of John with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 21 chapters.

questions.question: Who is described as 'the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world'?
questions.explanation: John 1:9 identifies Jesus as the true Light that enlightens every man coming into the world.

questions.question: What was John the Baptist's role according to John 1?
options: He baptized with water to prepare the way
He was a prophet like Elias
questions.correctAnswer: He baptized with water to prepare the way
questions.explanation: John 1:26-27 declares John baptized with water and prepared the way for Jesus, whom he was not worthy to unloose the shoe latchet.

questions.question: According to John 1, where was John baptizing when he saw Jesus?
questions.explanation: John 1:28 states John was baptizing at Bethabara beyond Jordan when he saw Jesus.

questions.question: What did John the Baptist call Jesus when he first saw Him?
questions.explanation: John 1:29 says John the Baptist called Jesus 'the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.'

questions.question: Who was one of the first disciples to follow Jesus after hearing John the Baptist?
questions.explanation: John 1:40 identifies Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, as one of the first disciples to follow Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 2, Jesus turned water into wine at a wedding in Cana.
questions.explanation: John 2:1-11 records Jesus' first miracle turning water into wine at Cana.

questions.question: Where did Jesus cleanse the temple by casting out the money changers?
questions.explanation: John 2:13-16 describes Jesus cleansing the temple in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What sign did Jesus say would prove His authority to cleanse the temple?
options: Destroying the temple and raising it in three days
questions.correctAnswer: Destroying the temple and raising it in three days
questions.explanation: John 2:19 records Jesus saying, 'Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.'

questions.question: True or False: Nicodemus came to Jesus at night to ask about being born again.
questions.explanation: John 3:1-2 describes Nicodemus visiting Jesus by night to discuss rebirth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have ________.'
questions.explanation: John 3:16 declares the promise of eternal life for believers.

questions.question: What did John the Baptist say about Jesus in John 3:30?
options: He must increase, but I must decrease
questions.correctAnswer: He must increase, but I must decrease
questions.explanation: John 3:30 states John the Baptist's humility about Jesus' rising prominence.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told the Samaritan woman at the well that He could give her living water.
questions.explanation: John 4:10 records Jesus offering living water to the Samaritan woman.

questions.question: Where did Jesus say true worshippers would worship the Father?
questions.explanation: John 4:23-24 teaches true worship is in spirit and truth, not location-dependent.

questions.question: Who was the royal official whose son Jesus healed after speaking to him in John 4?
questions.explanation: John 4:46-54 tells of a nobleman whose son was healed by Jesus' word.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus declared Himself as the bread of life in John 6.
questions.explanation: John 6:35 quotes Jesus saying He is the bread of life.

questions.question: How many people did Jesus feed with five barley loaves and two fishes?
questions.explanation: John 6:10 states about five thousand men were fed miraculously.

questions.question: After the feeding of the five thousand, what did Jesus do that amazed His disciples?
options: Preached the Sermon on the Mount
questions.explanation: John 6:19-20 recounts Jesus walking on the sea to His disciples' boat.

questions.question: What did Jesus say was the work of God in John 6?
options: To believe on Him whom God sent
To give alms to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: To believe on Him whom God sent
questions.explanation: John 6:29 explains that the work God requires is belief in Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said no man can come to Him unless the Father draws him.
questions.explanation: John 6:44 teaches that the Father must draw a person to Jesus for salvation.

questions.question: According to John 7, where did Jesus go secretly because the Jews sought to kill Him?
questions.explanation: John 7:1 states Jesus stayed in Galilee to avoid the Jews seeking to kill Him.

questions.question: Where was the Feast of Tabernacles held, where Jesus taught in John 7?
questions.explanation: John 7:2-14 shows Jesus teaching during the feast in Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said the Spirit would be given only after He was glorified.
questions.explanation: John 7:39 explains the Spirit was not yet given because Jesus was not yet glorified.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the living water in John 7?
options: It is the water of the Jordan
It is the Holy Spirit given to believers
It is the water from the temple
It is the water of baptism
questions.correctAnswer: It is the Holy Spirit given to believers
questions.explanation: John 7:37-39 describes living water as the Spirit given to those who believe.

questions.question: True or False: In John 8, Jesus declared, 'I am the light of the world.'
questions.explanation: John 8:12 quotes Jesus saying He is the light of the world.

questions.question: In John 8, who did Jesus say would know the truth, and the truth would make them free?
questions.explanation: John 8:32 teaches that knowing Jesus' word brings freedom through truth.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say was a murderer from the beginning and a liar in John 8?
questions.explanation: John 8:44 describes the devil as the father of lies and a murderer from the beginning.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus forgave the woman caught in adultery and told her to sin no more.
questions.explanation: John 8:11 records Jesus forgiving the adulterous woman and instructing her to go and sin no more.

questions.question: What did Jesus do when He healed the man born blind in John 9?
options: Spoke a word and the man saw
Anointed the man's eyes with clay and told him to wash in Siloam
questions.correctAnswer: Anointed the man's eyes with clay and told him to wash in Siloam
questions.explanation: John 9:6-7 recounts Jesus making clay, anointing the man's eyes, and instructing him to wash.

questions.question: True or False: The healed blind man confessed Jesus as a prophet after gaining sight.
questions.explanation: John 9:17 shows the man saying Jesus must be a prophet.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about Himself in John 10:11?
options: I am the door of the sheep
I am the way, the truth, and the life
I am the resurrection and the life
questions.explanation: John 10:11 quotes Jesus saying He is the good shepherd who lays down His life for the sheep.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said His sheep hear His voice and follow Him.
questions.explanation: John 10:27 states that Jesusâ€™ sheep hear His voice and follow Him.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I am the resurrection, and the _______: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live.'
questions.explanation: John 11:25 records Jesus' declaration of being the resurrection and the life.

questions.question: Who were the siblings of Lazarus in Bethany mentioned in John 11?
questions.explanation: John 11:1-2 identifies Mary and Martha as Lazarus' sisters.

questions.question: How long had Lazarus been dead before Jesus raised him?
questions.explanation: John 11:17 states Lazarus had been in the grave four days.

questions.question: What was Thomas' reaction when Jesus said they should go to Judea to see Lazarus?
options: Let's go, even if we die with Him
questions.correctAnswer: Let's go, even if we die with Him
questions.explanation: John 11:16 quotes Thomas saying, 'Let us also go, that we may die with him.'

questions.question: True or False: Jesus wept at Lazarus' tomb.
questions.explanation: John 11:35 records Jesus weeping at the tomb of Lazarus.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to Lazarus before he rose from the dead?
questions.explanation: John 11:43 shows Jesus commanding Lazarus to come forth from the grave.

questions.question: True or False: After Lazarus was raised, many of the Jews believed in Jesus.
questions.explanation: John 11:45 states many Jews believed because of the miracle.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed; And ye shall know the ________, and the truth shall make you free.'
questions.explanation: John 8:31-32 teaches that abiding in Jesus' word brings knowledge of truth and freedom.

questions.question: Where did Jesus wash His disciples' feet, showing humility and service?
questions.explanation: John 13:1-17 describes Jesus washing the disciples' feet in the upper room.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus gave the new commandment to love one another as He loved them.
questions.explanation: John 13:34 records Jesus commanding His disciples to love one another.

questions.question: Who did Jesus identify as the one who would betray Him during the Last Supper?
questions.explanation: John 13:21-27 reveals Jesus identified Judas as the betrayer.

questions.question: What promise did Jesus give about the Holy Spirit in John 14?
options: The Spirit will convict the world of sin
The Spirit will teach and remind the disciples of all things
The Spirit will come to glorify Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:16-17, 26, and 15:26 detail the Spirit convicting of sin, teaching, and glorifying Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said He and the Father are one.
questions.explanation: John 10:30 quotes Jesus saying, 'I and my Father are one.'

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his _______ for his friends.'
questions.explanation: John 15:13 states the greatest love is laying down one's life for friends.
